title.narrative: Envelope 2: Continuation the Enhancement of the Protective Environment and Access to Comprehensive Protection Support (GBV, CP) of Affected Communities in NWS.

description.narrative: Starting from the priorities identified by Protection Cluster and sub-clusters, SEMA under SCHF, seeks to provide life-saving protection prevention and response services through existing 2 CFS in Sharan and Al-Bab communities,SCHF-supported until 30 May 2022, will continue providing(CP case management, structured PSS parenting skills, awareness-raising, identification and referral through static and mobile teams, SNR Program for CwDs and parenting skill for caregivers). 4 CP outreach teams will provide awareness-raising on CP issues identified by community, recreational activities, identification and referral for at-risk CP cases.3 Case specialists in each CFS will provide comprehensive CP case management focusing on Child labor and imprisoned children, cases’needs will be addressed by referral to other sectors or through providing IPA.1CM supervisor in each CFS will supervise quality of CM and PSS Structured services.8 PSS animators will provide Structured PSS using Resilience and ECD Curricula, Parenting sessions using Parents skills and ECD Curricula, in addition to special sessions for caregivers of CwDs .Already formed 2 CPNs in Albab and Sharan will raise awareness of their communities on CP concerns.SEMA will conduct capacity building of humanitarian and non-humanitarian workers such as policemen and lawyers and educational staff on CPMS, Safe identification and Referral. SEMA will contribute to CPMTF reports on CP needs. Through CP intervention,target BN total number:16480 (M1100, W1300, B7040, G7040).Also preventive and responsive GBV services, and empowerment activities WampG with a focus on the most vulnerable ones, especially GBV survivors in 1WGSS in Sharan (ongoing), SEMA-managed hospitals(Ariha, Alfarabi) integrated with health services. GBV services such as GBV case management, focus PSS services,awareness-raising, life skills, AMAL initiative and empowerment activities(vocational training,income generation activity,small grants and inclusive livelihood opportunities) for women to start small projects.5 case managers will manage GBV cases and provide specialized life-saving services and referrals to ensure multisectoral response,6 PSS workersamp8 GBV Outreach workers worker will facilitate life skills for WampG, including WampG with disabilities, adolescent girls' focused GBV, and referrals at-risk to Case Manager. Through GBV intervention SEMA will target total number of BN 10730(M2466, W3934, B1620, G2777).
